intro: Gissonia sericea, commonly known as the silky gissonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Gissonia sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
